column4: I'm trying to configure the samba server on my linux, I went to system>administratio>networking, in the general tab the document (settingUpSamba) Talks about ticking "Enable windows networking" I can't see such things
i reccomend SWAT
thanks, cheking it now
its a web-based samba configuration utility... btw
how do I start the server?
nothing listening on port 901 now...!
tell me what this says: ls /etc/* | grep swat
in a terminal... btw
no output
netsta -an | grep 901 neither
yes inet.d
you need to edit that file and allow swat to run, and then make sure the inet daemon is restarted
its in there now, but should be commented out
where is inet.d located?
not sure, don't have that stuff on my system ATM
locate inet.d :D
/etc/inetd.conf
there is init.d but not inet.d
did you get my last message?
/etc/inetd.conf contains : netbios-ssn commented out, and swat (not commented)
ok, execute "sudo /etc/init.d/inet restart" i think. not sure what the NAME of the script is...
sure
